backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor defining types, persistent state, and business logic for a food redistribution platform including donation management, NGO matching, spoilage prediction, and role-based access control for hotels, NGOs, and admins.
feature_evidence.json: JSON report mapping feature IDs to their titles, associated source files, component dependencies, and test IDs for the Left2Lift platform features including authentication, hotel panel, and NGO profile registration.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON object containing one-sentence summaries of key frontend source files, noting specific bug fixes such as React hooks misuse and Tailwind class replacements applied in each file.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens including background, foreground, primary, secondary, chart, and sidebar variables.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell for the Left2Lift React app, mounting the root div and loading the main TypeScript module entry point.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that handles authentication state, profile loading, and role-based routing, rendering LoginScreen, RoleSelectionScreen, or the appropriate role panel (Hotel, NGO, Admin).
frontend/src/components/admin/AdminFoodS: Admin component that lists all donations in a table with food safety status (safe/unsafe), allowing admins to update donation statuses via a dropdown. Fetches hotel profiles to display hotel names alongside each donation row.
frontend/src/components/admin/AdminSyste: Admin dashboard component displaying platform-wide metrics (kg redistributed, total users, donations, waste reduced, estimated people fed) fetched from the system analytics hook, with loading skeletons.
frontend/src/components/admin/AdminUserM: Admin component that lists all registered hotels and NGOs in separate tables with their status, and allows admins to deactivate users via a confirmation prompt.
frontend/src/components/hotel/HotelDashb: Hotel-facing dashboard showing summary metrics (total donations, kg donated, completed deliveries, estimated people fed) and a sortable donation history table with status badges.
frontend/src/components/hotel/HotelDonat: Form component for hotels to submit food donations, collecting food type, quantity, storage condition, pickup address, and deadline, then displaying a spoilage-safety result and NGO match status after submission.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Shared layout wrapper providing a sticky header with logo, role badge, user display name, logout button, and a footer with branding for all authenticated panel pages.
frontend/src/components/ngo/NGODashboard: Displays an NGO dashboard with summary metrics (donations received, total kg, people served) and a full donation history table, fetching data via React Query hooks.
frontend/src/components/ngo/NGODonationR: Renders a list of donation request cards for an NGO, supporting accept/reject actions and displaying urgency/expiry states, with an embedded feedback form for completed donations.
frontend/src/components/ngo/NGOFeedbackF: A form component that allows NGOs to submit a star rating and optional comment for a completed donation using the submitFeedback mutation.
frontend/src/components/ngo/NGOProfileFo: A form for registering or updating an NGO profile, collecting organization name, address, daily capacity, and food type preferences, then submitting via the registerNGO mutation.
frontend/src/components/RoleSelectionScr: Two-step first-login screen where new users select a role (Hotel, NGO, Admin) and enter a display name, then save the profile to the backend via a mutation hook.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor using React Query, reinitializing and invalidating dependent queries whenever the Internet Identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useGetCallerUserProfi: A React Query hook that fetches the currently authenticated caller's user profile from the backend actor, gating the query until the actor is ready.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity authentication context and provider, managing AuthClient creation, login, logout, and identity persistence with status tracking.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for all backend interactions including hotel/NGO profile management, donation submission, acceptance, and admin operations using the actor pattern.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS file that sets up Tailwind, imports Inter/Poppins fonts, and defines a green/orange OKLCH-based design token theme for both light and dark modes.
frontend/src/lib/utils.ts: Utility functions for class merging (cn), formatting enums (food type, storage condition, donation status), status color mapping, and timestamp/date conversion helpers.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/AdminPanel.tsx: Admin page with three tabs (Analytics, Users, Food Safety) rendering the corresponding admin sub-components inside a shared Layout.
frontend/src/pages/HotelPanel.tsx: Hotel page with two tabs (New Donation form and Dashboard) for hotels to submit and track food donations.
frontend/src/pages/LoginScreen.tsx: Landing/login page showcasing the Left2Lift brand with a hero section and an Internet Identity login button, handling already-authenticated edge cases.
frontend/src/pages/NGOPanel.tsx: NGO page that shows a profile setup form if no profile exists, otherwise renders tabs for Donation Requests, Dashboard, and Profile editing.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting, persisting, and clearing URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage fallback support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom color palettes (green/orange primary/secondary using oklch), typography, border radius, box shadows, keyframe animations, and plugin setup for the Left2Lift frontend.
project_state.json: Project state manifest for Left2Lift, documenting architecture, tech stack, existing features, known issues, and design constraints for a full-stack AI-powered food redistribution platform.
